balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}. Requirements: - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length.

params._account: Address of the account to calculate the balance of
params._day: Day since inflation_day_zero to calculate the balance for
params._id: Circles identifier for which to calculate the balance

returns.balanceOnDay_: The discounted balance of the account for the Circles identifier on specified day
returns.discountCost_: The discount cost of the demurrage of the balance since the last update

params._data: (optional) additional data to be passed to the burn policy if they are group Circles
params._id: Circles identifier of the Circles to burn

params._human: Address of the human's avatar to calculate the issuance for.

returns._1: startPeriod The start of the claimable period.
returns._2: endPeriod The end of the claimable period.

params._human: address of the human avatar to calculate the issuance for

returns._0: issuance amount of Circles that can be minted
returns._1: startPeriod start of the claimable period
returns._2: endPeriod end of the claimable period

params._bootstrapTime: duration of the bootstrap period (for v1 registration) in seconds
params._gatewayUrl: gateway URL string for the ERC1155 metadata mirroring IPFS metadata storage (eg. "https://gateway.aboutcircles.com/v2/circles/{id}.json")
params._hubV1: address of the Hub v1 contract
params._inflationDayZero: timestamp of the start of the global inflation curve. For deployment on Gnosis Chain this parameter should be set to midnight 15 October 2020, or in unix time 1602786330 (deployment at 6:25:30 pm UTC) - 66330 (offset to midnight) = 1602720000.
params._standardTreasury: address of the standard treasury contract

params._day: Day since inflation_day_zero to convert the inflationary values to demurrage values.
params._inflationaryValues: Batch of inflationary values to convert to demurrage values.

params._day: Day since inflation_day_zero to convert the inflationary value to a demurrage value.
params._inflationaryValue: Inflationary value to convert to demurrage value.

params._timestamp: Timestamp for which to calculate the day since inflation_day_zero.

params._amounts: array of amounts of collateral to be used for minting
params._collateralAvatars: array of (personal or group) avatar addresses to be used as collateral
params._data: (optional) additional data to be passed to the mint policy, treasury and minter
params._group: address of the group avatar to mint Circles of

params._account: Address for which the balance is queried.
params._id: Circles identifier for which the balance is queried.

params._human: avatar of the human to invite

params._group: address of the group to check

params._human: address of the human to check

params._organization: address of the organization to check

params._amounts: array of amounts in inflationary v1 units to migrate
params._avatars: array of avatar addresses to migrate
params._owner: address of the owner of the v1 Circles and beneficiary of the v2 Circles

params._metatdataDigest: metadata digest for the group metadata
params._mint: mint address will be called before minting group circles
params._name: immutable name of the group Circles
params._symbol: immutable symbol of the group Circles

params._metatdataDigest: sha256 digest for the group metadata
params._mint: mint address will be called before minting group circles
params._name: immutable name of the group Circles
params._symbol: immutable symbol of the group Circles

params._metatdataDigest: (optional) sha256 metadata digest for the avatar metadata should follow ERC1155 metadata standard.
Metadata digest for the organization metadata

params._data: Data to pass to the receiver.
params._from: Address from which the Circles are transferred.
params._ids: Batch of Circles identifiers for which the Circles are transferred.
params._inflationaryValues: Batch of inflationary values of the Circles transferred.
params._to: Address to which the Circles are transferred.

params._data: Data to pass to the receiver.

params._id: Circles indentifier for which the Circles are transferred.
params._inflationaryValue: Inflationary value of the Circles transferred.
params._to: Address to which the Circles are transferred.

params._human: address of avatar of the human to check whether it is stopped

params._avatar: avatar address to convert to tokenId

params._id: Circles identifier for which to calculate the total supply

trust(address,uint96).details: Trust is directional and can be set by the caller to any address. The trusted address does not (yet) have to be registered in the Hub contract.

params._expiry: expiry time in seconds since unix epoch until when trust is valid
params._trustReceiver: address that is trusted by the caller

uri(uint256).details: See {IERC1155MetadataURI-uri}. This implementation returns the same URI for *all* token types. It relies on the token type ID substitution mechanism https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1155#metadata[defined in the EIP]. Clients calling this function must replace the `\{id\}` substring with the actual token type ID.

advancedUsageFlags(address).notice: By default the advanced usage flags should remain set to zero. Only for advanced purposes people can consider enabling flags.

avatars(address).notice: The mapping of registered avatar addresses to the next avatar address, stored as a linked list.

balanceOfOnDay(address,uint256,uint64).notice: Balance of a Circles identifier for a given account on a (future) day.

burn(uint256,uint256,bytes).notice: Burn allows to burn Circles owned by the caller.

calculateIssuance(address).notice: Calculate the demurraged issuance for a human's avatar.

calculateIssuanceWithCheck(address).notice: Calculate issuance allows to calculate the issuance for a human avatar with a check to update the v1 mint status if updated.

convertBatchInflationaryToDemurrageValue.notice: Converts a batch of inflationary values to demurrage values for a given day since inflation_day_zero.

convertInflationaryToDemurrageValue(uint.notice: Converts an inflationary value to a demurrage value for a given day since inflation_day_zero.

day(uint256).notice: Calculate the day since inflation_day_zero for a given timestamp.

groupMint(address,address[],uint256[],by.notice: Group mint allows to mint group Circles by providing the required collateral.

inflationDayZero().notice: Inflation day zero stores the start of the global inflation curve As Circles Hub v1 was deployed on Thursday 15th October 2020 at 6:25:30 pm UTC, or 1602786330 unix time, in production this value MUST be set to 1602720000 unix time, or midnight prior of the same day of deployment, marking the start of the first day where there was no inflation on one CRC per hour.

inflationaryBalanceOf(address,uint256).notice: Inflationary balance of an account for a Circles identifier. Careful, calculating the inflationary balance can introduce numerical errors in the least significant digits (order of few attoCircles).

inviteHuman(address).notice: Invite human allows to register another human avatar. The inviter must burn twice the welcome bonus of their own Circles, and the invited human receives the welcome bonus in their personal Circles. The inviter is set to trust the invited avatar.

isGroup(address).notice: Checks if an avatar is registered as a group.

isHuman(address).notice: Checks if an avatar is registered as a human.

isOrganization(address).notice: Checks if an avatar is registered as an organization.

isTrusted(address,address).notice: Returns true if the truster trusts the trustee.

migrate(address,address[],uint256[]).notice: Migrate allows to migrate v1 Circles to v2 Circles. During bootstrap period, no invitation cost needs to be paid for new humans to be registered. After the bootstrap period the same invitation cost applies as for normal invitations, and this requires the owner to be a human and to have enough personal Circles to pay the invitation cost. Organizations and groups have to ensure all humans have been registered after the bootstrap period. Can only be called by the migration contract.

mintPolicies(address).notice: The mapping of group avatar addresses to the mint policy contract address.

personalMint().notice: Personal mint allows to mint personal Circles for a registered human avatar.

registerCustomGroup(address,address,stri.notice: Register custom group allows to register a group with a custom treasury contract.

registerGroup(address,string,string,byte.notice: Register group allows to register a group avatar.

registerHuman(bytes32).notice: Register human allows to register an avatar for a human, if they have a stopped v1 Circles contract, during the bootstrap period.

registerOrganization(string,bytes32).notice: Register organization allows to register an organization avatar.

safeInflationaryBatchTransferFrom(addres.notice: safeInflationaryBatchTransferFrom transfers Circles from one address to another by specifying inflationary units.

safeInflationaryTransferFrom(address,add.notice: safeInflationaryTransferFrom transfers Circles from one address to another by specifying inflationary units.

stop().notice: Stop allows to stop future mints of personal Circles for this avatar. Must be called by the avatar itself. This action is irreversible.

stopped(address).notice: Stopped checks whether the avatar has stopped future mints of personal Circles.

toTokenId(address).notice: Casts an avatar address to a tokenId uint256.

totalSupply(uint256).notice: Total supply of a Circles identifier.

treasuries(address).notice: The mapping of group avatar addresses to the treasury contract address.

trust(address,uint96).notice: Trust allows to trust another address for a certain period of time. Expiry times in the past are set to the current block timestamp.

trustMarkers(address,address).notice: The iterable mapping of directional trust relations between avatars and their expiry times.

documentation.text:
Register human allows to register an avatar for a human,
 and returns the status of the associated v1 Circles contract.
 Additionally set the trust to self indefinitely.
 @param _human address of the human to be registered

Checks the status of an avatar's Circles in the Hub v1 contract,
 and returns the address of the Circles if it exists and is not stopped.
 Else, it returns the zero address if no Circles exist,
 and it returns the address CIRCLES_STOPPED_V1 (0x1) if the Circles contract is stopped.
 @param _avatar avatar address for which to check registration in Hub v1

mapping(address => mapping(address => struct TypeDefinitions.TrustMarker storage ref))

documentation.text:
@dev Internal function to upsert a trust marker for a truster and a trusted address.
 It will initialize the linked list for the truster if it does not exist yet.
 If the trustee is not yet trusted by the truster, it will insert the trust marker.
 It will update the expiry time for the trusted address.

@title Hub v2 contract for Circles
 @notice The Hub contract is the main contract for the Circles protocol.
 It adopts the ERC1155 standard for multi-token contracts and governs
 the personal and group Circles of people, organizations and groups.
 Circle balances are demurraged in the Hub contract.
 It registers the trust relations between people and groups and allows
 to transfer Circles to be path fungible along trust relations.
 It further allows to wrap any token into an inflationary or demurraged
 ERC20 Circles contract.
